messages.title: Change in Penistone & Stocksbridge
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown's government - with more debts, waste and taxes - will bring us a new recession.

messages.title: LABOUR'S TAX ON JOBS WILL KILL THE RECOVERY
messages.content: The next 13 years working people have seen their taxes go up and up and their money wasted. Labour politicians admit there is at least Â£11 billion of waste, but they want to waft a year before doing anything. Instead of cutting waste now, they want to wait - wait until the election is over. It is very clear we can't go on like this.

messages.title: WORKING FOR THE COMMUNITY
messages.content: Spencer is in Courtiers nearly every day and his ten years as a local schoolmaster mean he understands the importance of local children having the best start in life and goes to the heart of what makes our community tick.

messages.title: WORKING HARD FOR EVERYONE
messages.content: David Cameron's recent visit to the area highlighted how the Conservatives can help, especially in these difficult economic times.

messages.title: BACKING THE NHS
messages.content: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone.

messages.title: SUPPORTING OUR NHS
messages.content: Few things matter more to our country than the National Health Service. Conservatives rely on the NHS, work in the NHS and volunteer to help the NHS. We understand the pressures on NHS finances. We want to improve our National Health Service for everyone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Understanding the importance of cutting waste to avoid new taxes and help the recovery from the recession; opposing Labour's tax on jobs.
Making the NHS the number one priority, ensuring it receives any necessary increases in financing, improving medical treatments to the best achievable levels, and cutting waiting times.
Emphasizing the importance of local children receiving the best possible educational start.

issues.economy: Opposes Labour's tax on jobs, concerned that it will kill the recovery. Mentioned that Labour has increased taxes and wasted money and that alternatives to cutting waste now are not being considered.
issues.education: Spencer Pitfield, with ten years as a local schoolmaster, understands the importance of local children having the best start in life.
issues.health: The NHS is a top priority, with a focus on improving the service for everyone. Conservatives are committed to improving NHS finances, treatments, and reducing waiting times.

politicalExperience.achievements: Understanding the importance of local children having the best start in life.

endorsements.endorsement: Visited the area and highlighted how the Conservatives can help, especially in these difficult economic times.

images.caption: Spencer Pitfield Working Hard for You

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet promotes Spencer Pitfield as a candidate who understands the community and is actively engaged in improving the local area. His background as a schoolmaster is a central theme to his commitment to education.
